ygData.subject: Re: /con Artists
ygData.msgSnippet: You can say that again, Bob. When Dvinn finally conned Green to me, I thought, Heh heh, payback, inkie! and went in the tower and waited for him, tapping my
ygData.messageBody:
You can say that again, Bob.

When Dvinn finally conned Green to me, I thought, "Heh heh, payback, inkie!"
and went in the tower and waited for him, tapping my sword in my hand.

He spawns. I con to make sure "green" just before he leaps upon me... and
proceeds to thoroughly and quickly, and neatly, destroy me. Instead of
taking 4 seconds to die to him when I was lower level, instead, it took
about 15 seconds (smile).

The /con system is either broken, or intentionally left to mislead you. I
believe Verant intends you to "con" critters by actually fighting them,
rather than relying upon a computer to tell you the exact level your
opponent may be. Lately, the only reason I con something is to see if I will
get experience or not. Otherwise, to me, Conning is a complete and utter
waste of time.

Just my 2 copper's worth,
Tallonn



-----Original Message-----
From: Bob Stewart <dreambard@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, July 16, 1999 2:28 PM
Subject: [eqbards] /con Artists


>
>In fact the /con system is somewhat deceptive and dangerous. Verant's
>assignment of levels and abilities versus effectiveness appears seriously
>inconsistent.
